note.p: Death: Great James Street, Bedford Row (08 February 1807)

Career: Went to Barbados after marrying Rebecca Hog without the approval of his and his wife's family (1767) and pursued legal action against the Hog's of Newliston for her maintenance and inheritance; medical practice in Barbados; imprisoned as a debtor in King's Bench Prison (15 May 1794-c1805); from his will, he was a mortgage holder for a plantation in Barbados that used enslaved people for labour
References: King's (Queen's) Bench, Fleet, Marshalsea and Queen's Prisons: Miscellanea. Records of the King's Bench, Fleet, and Marshalsea prisons, Series PRIS 10. The National Archives, Kew, England
